remarks: If two structures have the same components (properties), they have the same set of bases.  (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 9-Feb-2015.) (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 14-Jun-2015.)
statement:
lbspropd.b1 $e |- ( ph -> B = ( Base ` K ) ) $.
lbspropd.b2 $e |- ( ph -> B = ( Base ` L ) ) $.
lbspropd.w $e |- ( ph -> B C_ W ) $.
lbspropd.p $e |- ( ( ph /\ ( x e. W /\ y e. W ) ) -> ( x ( +g ` K ) y ) = ( x ( +g ` L ) y ) ) $.
lbspropd.s1 $e |- ( ( ph /\ ( x e. P /\ y e. B ) ) -> ( x ( .s ` K ) y ) e. W ) $.
lbspropd.s2 $e |- ( ( ph /\ ( x e. P /\ y e. B ) ) -> ( x ( .s ` K ) y ) = ( x ( .s ` L ) y ) ) $.
lbspropd.f $e |- F = ( Scalar ` K ) $.
lbspropd.g $e |- G = ( Scalar ` L ) $.
lbspropd.p1 $e |- ( ph -> P = ( Base ` F ) ) $.
lbspropd.p2 $e |- ( ph -> P = ( Base ` G ) ) $.
lbspropd.a $e |- ( ( ph /\ ( x e. P /\ y e. P ) ) -> ( x ( +g ` F ) y ) = ( x ( +g ` G ) y ) ) $.
lbspropd.v1 $e |- ( ph -> K e. _V ) $.
lbspropd.v2 $e |- ( ph -> L e. _V ) $.
lbspropd $p |- ( ph -> ( LBasis ` K ) = ( LBasis ` L ) ) $.
$d B x y $.
$d F x y $.
$d G x y $.
$d K x y $.
$d L x y $.
$d P x y $.
$d W x y $.
$d ph x y $.
